Node.definition: = a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Berechiah (בֶּרֶכְיָהוּ) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► temple singer; time of king David (דָּוִד)
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which an event happens entirely as desired or required, without any interference that could be considered a flaw
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= pertaining to being very likely to take place
literally: to turn aside (from the right way); hence: = action by which humans deviate from what is considered to be the right way to conduct their lives
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= marker indicating that a certain event would occur but was finally avoided
literally: to be poured out; hence: = process by which an object loses grip with a surface

literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure

Node.gloss: to envy|to be envious|to be jealous of (someone else)
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself

= action by which humans express their pride and satisfaction about themselves, their actions, certain circumstances they find themselves in, or a deity that they consider responsible for those circumstances

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: cords used to bind people so that they cannot freely move about; hence: = things that affect the life of a person and from which that person cannot easily free him/herself
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= state in which a human or animal has a lot of excess fat; ≈ considered a sign of health and wealth
meaning unsure; possibly: = human body, or part of it
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: to touch; hence: = causative action by which humans, deities or forces cause harm to humans or objects
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
literally: to come out; hence: = state in which an object extends into a certain direction
= fat parts ◄ of the body of animals and human beings; ► often the main ingredient of a sacrifice; ≈ regarded as the best part of the meat, but also associated with unresponsiveness and stubbornness

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= a process by which the human mind forms ideas or mental images
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans utter words that are intended to provoke shame in other humans

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to put (one's) mouth in heaven; hence, possibly: = action by which humans speak inappropriately about God; ≈ associated with arrogance
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
read וּמֵי מָלֵא יִמָּצוּ as וּמוּם לאֹ יִמָּצוּ

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
literally: to cause to grow; hence: = causative process by which humans cause objects to increase in quantity
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
literally: empty; hence: = state in which an event does not serve a useful purpose and is bound to fail
= process by which someone maintains him/herself upright and innocent in character and behavior
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to take a bath|to bathe|to wash
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness
= state in which someone or something is without or free from guilt
literally: to wash one's palms in innocence; hence: = to live a life of integrity doing one's utmost to keep from sin
literally: to touch; hence: = causative action by which humans, deities or forces cause harm to humans or objects
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= group of people sharing a certain characteristic or behavior, usually in poetic texts
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= action by which humans exercise their mind (לֵב) with the purpose of achieving something
literally: to know; hence: = action by which humans exercise their minds with regards to a certain matter so that they will know what to do
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= state in which an object has a relatively even and regular surface, free from perceptible projections or lumps or indentations; ≈ often associated with danger and insincerity

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
literally: to cause to fall; hence: = causative process or action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to be killed or severely wounded by enemies

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= a very short length of time
= something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness
= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment
= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= process by which someone wakes up from his sleep
= state in which humans and deities are, or are perceived as, having something in common with other humans and deities

Node.gloss: to despise|to disdain|to scorn|to consider (something) beneath (oneself)
Node.definition: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
literally: one's לֵבָב (לֵבָב) heart has become sour; hence: = state in which humans are extremely displeased about something
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: kidney; hence: = seat of a person's emotions and devotion to God, created by God, and hidden to everyone but God himself
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which someone lacks intelligence, refinement and culture
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= referent to the time after the event in focus
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to be finished; hence: = process by which humans feel physically weak as a result of hardship or a deeply felt wish for something to happen
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
figurative extension of a rock as place of refuge: = deity that protects and provides refuge
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= someone with whom one has a close, affectionate, and exclusive relationship ◄ as if it were a private possession
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention

Node.gloss: to destroy|to wipe out|to annihilate|to silence|to consume
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events remove (other) humans from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, sickness, strong emotions, or (possibly) direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= action by which humans engage in non sanctioned worship, ◄ described in terms of prostitution
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to put their trust (in someone else)
Node.definition: literally: to put as (one's) refuge; hence: = action by which humans decide that they will put their trust in a deity ► in order to find protection or safety
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= person in whom one has put one's trust; ◄ because of difficult circumstances; ► in order to find protection or safety

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
